thread.title: Chicago Bears 'Actively' Shopping Jay Cutler

author: Ryan Phillips
title: Chicago Bears 'Actively' Shopping Jay Cutler
text:
Chicago Bears 'Actively' Shopping Jay Cutler The Big Lead 6 hrs ago Ryan Phillips Click to expand Replay Video UP NEXT How will the 2017 quarterback carousel shake out? NFL Media columnist Michael Silver joins Steve Wyche, Tiffany Blackmon and Jeffri Chadiha to discuss where some of the big name quarterbacks will land. NFL Calipari says he won't consider coaching in New Orleans Bill Reiter shares his thoughts on John Calipari saying he won't coach in New Orleans. CBS Sports Sosa compares himself to Jesus in PED defense In a Skype interview with a former Chicago Cubs' media relations employee, Sosa compared himself to Jesus when defending himself against PED accusations. Sports Illustrated 1 Cancel SETTINGS OFF HD HQ SD LO Bears actively trying to trade Jay Cutler USA Today Sports Video See more videos SHARE SHARE TWEET SHARE EMAIL What to watch next How will the 2017 quarterback carousel shake out? NFL 4:50 Calipari says he won't consider coaching in New Orleans CBS Sports 1:01 Sosa compares himself to Jesus in PED defense Sports Illustrated 0:41 Significant interest in Jimmy Garoppolo? NFL 0:43 Cutler trade chatter: 4 best destinations for Bears QB USA Today Sports Video 0:48 Magic Johnson named Lakers president of basketball ops USA TODAY SPORTS 1:00 Isaiah Thomas, Andre Drummond create Twitter frenzy CBS Sports 1:07 Miami and USC on way to being national title contenders? CBS Sports 2:03 Will Davis and Cousins work well together? USA Today Sports Video 2:20 Highlights: Baylor's Motley was all over the court vs. Oklahoma Campus Insiders 0:35 Will Cousins be with the Redskins in 2017? NFL 3:22 Countdown to the Masters USA Today Sports Video 1:37 Who will be Ohio State's QB of the future? CBS Sports 1:40 One-armed 6-year-old takes on PGA Tour golfers USA TODAY SPORTS 1:37 National title or bust for 'Bama's new offensive coordinator? CBS Sports 1:43 You gotta see Texas' Allen throw down seriously ferocious dunk CBS Sports 0:31 UP NEXT Jay Cutler and the Chicago Bears are surely headed for a split this offseason and the team is doing whatever it can to find a trade parter for its emotionless signal-caller. The Bears are reportedly "actively" shopping the 33-year-old in the hopes that someone would take him off their hands.
Chicago Bears have actively started seeking a trade partner for quarterback Jay Cutler, per @JeffDarlington .
- Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) February 21, 2017
Cutler has been bad for years in Chicago, and now the guaranteed portion of his ill-fated seven-year, $126.7 million contract has run out. He's due a base salary of $12.5 million next year with a $2.5 million roster bonus. The Vanderbilt product is not worth anything close to that, so the Bears are likely to just cut him if they can't find a trading partner.
The New York Jets and Arizona Cardinals have been eliminated as potential destinations if you believe reports emanating from both front offices. That severely limits Chicago's options.
Cutler hasn't played a full 16-game schedule since 2009, his first year in Chicago. In 2016, he only appeared in five games and was largely terrible. He completed just 59.1 percent of his passes for 1,059 yards, with four touchdowns and five interceptions. Cutler's career quarterback rating of 85.7 is indicative of his worth. He's an average quarterback prone to making awful decisions with the ball and hurting his team more than he helps.
People still salivate over Cutler's arm potential despite ample evidence that his raw ability has never translated to sustained on-field success. He's a gunslinger without the ability to properly read defenses and make the right reads, which means he relies on his ample arm strength far too much. That has always gotten him into trouble.
Try as they might, it's hard to see the Bears actually finding a trade parter for Cutler.
